keyword: calories in a tsp of peanut butter
title: Calories in a Teaspoon of Peanut Butter
meta_description: Discover calories in a tsp of peanut butter, including fat, protein, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in a Teaspoon of Peanut Butter
assumptions: Smooth, natural peanut butter without added sugar or salt; approximately 5 g per teaspoon.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ingredients (e.g., added oils/sugars), and exact measurement. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A teaspoon of peanut butter provides about 32 kcal and 1.3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Chunky peanut butter (with extra peanut pieces)

faqs.q: How many calories in a tsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: About 32 kcal for one teaspoon of natural peanut butter.

faqs.q: Is peanut butter high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, one tsp has 2.8 g total fat, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.
One tsp provides 1.3 g protein, making it a good snack addition.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a tsp of peanut butter?
faqs.a: Low at 0.8 g carbs, with 0.3 g fiber and 0.2 g sugars.

faqs.q: How does brand affect calories in peanut butter?
faqs.a: Added sugars or oils in commercial brands can increase calories by 5-10 kcal per tsp.
